entry.title: You'll Realise Soon Enough
entry.summary:
Author: frazzzzg

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,759Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Buck's whole world is turned upside down when he finds out that his best friend - Eddie Diaz - is interested in moving to El Paso to be reunited with his son Christopher. If life was unbearable itself without Christopher (which it absolutely was), and if his best friend had to leave too (which he probably did), how would he ever learn to cope? The thought of not being able to sleep on that couch with the comfort of Eddie's presence a few mere walls away shattered something inside of Buck, something deeper than just his friendship with the other. Something more exclusive than a mutually friendly relationship - something that he was choosing to supress.OR Buck and Eddie hopelessly pining over each other without even realising.

entry.title: Streetlights and moonbeams
entry.summary:
Author: Buddiesmutslut

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,338Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 0

Summary: If you would’ve asked Buck at 13 what he thought he’d be when he grew up, he never would’ve guessed this.He would’ve said something like a vet, or a professional skateboarder, or an astronaut. Hell, maybe the next Evil Knievel or some other adrenaline junky hobby that he got paid for being the stupidest at.Never in his life would he have guessed that by age 24, he’d be a murderer - let alone that he’d get paid to do it eventually.-After sweeping Christopher back to Texas, the Diaz parents realize that it's only a matter of time before their son steps up and takes him back, and they'll lose their grandson for good.So, they get in contact with Evan Buckley - murderer for hire - to get rid of Eddie, permanently.Nobody is expecting what happens next.

entry.title: All I Ask
entry.summary:
Author: 911L118F

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 727Chapters: 1/10Kudos: 2

Summary: You act like you're expendable... but you're wrong" Are the only words running relentlessly through Buck's mind as he helps his best friend pack up his life, to be yet another person to leave him. Making him expendable once again." Okay... I think we've packed up just about everything!" He instantly regretted saying those words. All Eddie wanted was for Buck to tell him not to go, to stay there with him. But he won't. Not when the reason Eddie's leaving is to get his kid, the only person they both love more than anyone else. ORBuck and Eddie fight about Eddie leaving and Buck gets hurt!Enjoy!!

entry.title: Lighthouse
entry.summary:
Author: KilldevilandtheWildThings

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 89,420Chapters: 16/28Kudos: 624

Summary: Buck had lost-- he was sure of this now. His resolve only lasted a few weeks before his exterior began to crack; he was never a very good actor. He couldn’t keep up the greetings and the asking questions and the easy stroll. He let his shoulders creep up to his ears, let his foot tap incessantly. He did what his Captain told him, but stopped asking for anything more. Stopped following the conversation in the back of the engine on the way to the call; he just stared out the window, thinking about the case to come, preparing for it. When he woke every morning, there was no big recovery milestone to strive for, no big fight for the soul of his career to win. Not even the happy swell of being back on shift -- something so easy to dismiss, that had dominated so much of his life, that he had taken for granted-- that had catalyzed him each morning of his first week back.An old habit of his had returned. A bad habit.~~or: after the lawsuit, buck confronts what it was he wanted all along. he looks and looks and longs for it; the team look right through him. buck breaks-- right down the middle.

entry.title: I Wanna be in the Sequel
entry.summary:
Author: OrYouCouldHaveMine

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 120,398Chapters: 24/24Kudos: 757

Summary: It's a few months after Maddie kills her husband and stages it to look like a suicide that she moves to LA to live with her brother. Buck was fired from the fire department and was seeking meaning. Maddie was facing freedom for the first time in her life and seeking justice for others like her.The 9-1-1 call center is the perfect spot to get details on where some of the most evil people in LA live. Maddie gets their info. Buck takes care of them in disguise. It's foolproof, until one night, Buck ends up at the wrong house.or: A 9-1-1 meets Scream (1996) AUthe Buckley siblings work together to rid the world of abusers though some nonconventional methods. Buck is Ghostface, a serial killer running loose in LA. Maddie is the mastermind behind it. Taylor Kelly is the pesky reporter. And Eddie Diaz? He's the almost accidental victim, the new friend, the obsession that bleeds into the blurry space where Buck and Ghostface come together. He's everything Buck wants. He's everything Ghostface knows he can't have.But what if Eddie wants both of them?
